DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS
ADMINISTRATION BUILDING
414 FOURTEENTH STREET
DENVER 2, COLORADO
Kenneth E. Oberholtzer, superintendent
April 28, 1954
RECEIVED
NAEB HEADQUARTERS
Mr. Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director, national Association
of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
MAY
A M

i
Dear Mr. Skornia:
Thank you for your April 26 letter. I
have written to Mr. Edward G. Hasp, Jr. whose
name was suggested in the list from Hew Jersey. I
am not at all sure about Mr. King himself. Is he
to be considered as a possible manager for an
educational TV station? Of the group whose names
were submitted, Mr. Rasp seemed to me to be the
best qualified for consideration.
You may circularize the position of
manager or director (whichever title you think is
better) for the station here in Denver.
We have assumed all along that we would
hire a manager or director, and then, together
with him, hire the other key personnel of the
station excepting the engineer. We have in mind a
person who qualifies for the engineer for the
station.
Thank you for any assistance you may be
able to give us.
Cordially yours.
KVrineth E. Oberholt,
Superintendent of
